N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 169.3 - Approval of grants

State Regulations
(a) Grants for
employer specific training, pursuant to Education Law, section
3032
(4), and
additional grants for employer specific training pursuant to Education Law, section
3032
(5), may be
awarded for a project which provides for: (1)
training programs for a business or industry which intends to locate in New

York State; or
(2)
training
programs for a business or industry located in New York State which is
expanding its current operations; or
(3)
training programs to help a business or
industry located in New York State remain in the State; or
(4)
retraining and upgrading for personnel in
a business or industry located in New York State to help such personnel keep
pace with technological innovations or other changes in the economy; or
(5)
training programs for
individuals to promote the successful management and/or operation of a business
purchased by such individuals to provide for their continued employment through
the formation of a worker-owned cooperative or an employee stock ownership
plan. (b) The
commissioner will appoint within each region of the State a coordinating
committee consisting of representatives of educational institutions, business
and labor, and such other individuals as the commissioner may appoint. The
committee shall make recommendations to the commissioner on each project
submitted by a local education agency located within such committee's
region. (c) Applications shall be
on a form prescribed by the commissioner and may be submitted by a local
education agency at any time during the fiscal year. (d) If any funds allocated to a region for
grants pursuant to subdivision 4 of section 3032 of the Education Law are not
committed for the purposes of such subdivision by November 15th, the
commissioner may reallocate some or all of such funds to projects in other
regions of the State in accordance with the provisions of this Part. (e) If any funds allocated to a region for
grants pursuant to subdivision 5 of section 3032 of the Education Law are not
committed for the purposes of such subdivision by March first, or are committed
prior to March first and are subsequently found to be unnecessary for
expenditure to meet existing contractual obligations, the commissioner shall
reallocate such funds to projects in other regions of the State in accordance
with such subdivision. (f) Not less
than 20 percent of the funds allocated to a region for purposes of Education

Law, section 3032(5) shall be available for training programs which will
provide placements for persons who are economically disadvantaged or dislocated
workers. Notes
